trans-unit.source: Rename in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Rename in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for renaming objects and databases in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for renaming objects and databases in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server supports object and database renaming via the stored procedure sprename and sprenamedb respectively.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server supports object and database renaming via the stored procedure sprename and sprenamedb respectively.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse uses DDL syntax to achieve the same goal.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse uses DDL syntax to achieve the same goal.

trans-unit.source: The DDL commands are RENAME OBJECT and RENAME DATABASE.
trans-unit.target: The DDL commands are RENAME OBJECT and RENAME DATABASE.

trans-unit.source: It is important to understand that the name only affects the object being renamed - there is no propagation of the name change.
trans-unit.target: It is important to understand that the name only affects the object being renamed - there is no propagation of the name change.

trans-unit.source: Consequently any views using the old name of an object will be invalid until an object with the old name has been created.
trans-unit.target: Consequently any views using the old name of an object will be invalid until an object with the old name has been created.

trans-unit.source: Consequently you will often see RENAME OBJECT appearing in pairs.
trans-unit.target: Consequently you will often see RENAME OBJECT appearing in pairs.

trans-unit.source: Database renaming is very similar to that of object.
trans-unit.target: Database renaming is very similar to that of object.

trans-unit.source: It is important to remember that you cannot rename an object or a database if other users are connected to it or are using it.
trans-unit.target: It is important to remember that you cannot rename an object or a database if other users are connected to it or are using it.

trans-unit.source: You may need to terminate open sessions first.
trans-unit.target: You may need to terminate open sessions first.

trans-unit.source: To terminate a session you need to use the <linkText>KILL</linkText><title></title> command.
trans-unit.target: To terminate a session you need to use the <linkText>KILL</linkText><title></title> command.

trans-unit.source: Please be careful when using KILL.
trans-unit.target: Please be careful when using KILL.

trans-unit.source: Once executed the targeted session will be terminated and any uncommitted work will be rolled back.
trans-unit.target: Once executed the targeted session will be terminated and any uncommitted work will be rolled back.

trans-unit.source: Sessions in SQL Data Warehouse are prefixed by 'SID' you will need to include this and the the session number when invoking the KILL command.
trans-unit.target: Sessions in SQL Data Warehouse are prefixed by 'SID' you will need to include this and the the session number when invoking the KILL command.

trans-unit.source: For example KILL 'SID1234' would kill session 1234 - assuming you have the right permissions to execute it.
trans-unit.target: For example KILL 'SID1234' would kill session 1234 - assuming you have the right permissions to execute it.

trans-unit.source: In order to rename a database you may need to kill sessions connected to your SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: In order to rename a database you may need to kill sessions connected to your SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: The following query will generate a distinct list of KILL commands to clear the connections (save for the current session).
trans-unit.target: The following query will generate a distinct list of KILL commands to clear the connections (save for the current session).

trans-unit.source: If the intent is to change the schema that an object belongs to then that is achieved via ALTER SCHEMA:
trans-unit.target: If the intent is to change the schema that an object belongs to then that is achieved via ALTER SCHEMA:

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see <linkText>development overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see <linkText>development overview</linkText><title></title>.
